abstract: Walter Berns, a distinguished constitutional scholar and government professor whose ideas propelled him to become a leading voice of the American neoconservative movement, dies at age 95.
lead_paragraph: Professor Berns’s dissatisfaction with Cornell’s response to a takeover of a campus building by black students in 1969 fueled a group of intellectuals who blamed liberalism for many ills.
snippet: Professor Berns’s dissatisfaction with Cornell’s response to a takeover of a campus building by black students in 1969 fueled a group of intellectuals who blamed liberalism for many ills.

headline.main: Walter Berns, Whose Ideas Fueled Neoconservative Movement, Dies at 95
